reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: So, I am not a wine drinker, but came with a group of girlfriends who were and we came into this place. My bestie knows me well and Gay Nell was amazing to help determine which wines would be the best to try that would give me an opportunity to find something that may work for me.  I ended up buying my first bottle of wine - Sandia... and walked away having a few that were pretty good. I am learning more about what wines might be more my style. However, truth be told.. still love my margaritas and rum (Sailor Jerry) and diet, hands down.  Thank you Gay Nell, well done and a super fab lady!

reviews.author: Julia K.
reviews.description: Tastings were fun.  The service was fantastic.  Left with 3 bottles of wine.  Try the Texas Well Water, my husband who does not like or drink wine even said he would be helping me with the 3 bottles.

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: My friends and I were visiting Fredericksburg for a quick "stay-cay" and picked this spot because of the cute outdoor area.   The wines were amazing and the service was excellent. We ended up purchasing enough wine to cover our wine tastings and went home happy with plenty of wine to enjoy!

reviews.author: Kim T.
reviews.description: First time visiting this winery and it is amazing. The customer service is outstanding and I felt really taken care of. You can also enjoy your wine and walk around the shops here as it is legal in marble falls :) 10/10

reviews.author: Heather G.
reviews.description: Love love love this place. My first Fiesta experience was in Fredericksburg so I had to check out the one in Marble Falls. Staff is always super kind and helpful and I've never had a bad wine at Fiesta. I'll be back soon!!

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Atmosphere: really cute place in this little plaza where yo can get your wine and go outside and sit at the tables. The lady working at the front was really kind, offered some great suggestions given our usual taste in wine is not on the sweet side but on the dry side.  Wine. To continue, I'm not actually sure if they have anything besides sweet wines since we parted ways from our syrahs and cabs to opt for a white peach sangria slushy and a chilled sweet red blend on this very hot day. The slushy was sweet and easy to drink (maybe a little too fast) and the red was good too. Next time I'll definitely have to drink the red first then the slushy to have it make more sense to my taste buds, they got confused. I'd get both again.   Price: pretty normal prices so I don't really have much to say here. Next time I'd like to come back and get some of the cans of wine and take them with me!

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: First time we went to Fiesta Winery we signed up to be members because the wine is so good and a great deal! The staff is wonderful. We live about 30 minutes away and enjoy going. You can have a to go cup of wine and walk the Main Street to look at the shops. There are tons of options. They also have cheese plates. Five star!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: Really glad Marble Falls continues to grow and now has a couple of breweries and wineries. Fiesta is a great stop especially for those visiting or shopping because it's located on Main Street by all the shops. My parents who live in Marble Falls love this place and are members here. Stop by and check them out!

reviews.author: Rebecca S.
reviews.description: Because of COVID I couldn't do a tasting but I got great service and left with 2 bottles and a 4 pack of the Lime in the Coconut

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: Why would you close at 6 on a Friday!? All the breweries were open until 10 but I can't have gluten so my first night in town started off poorly. Plus the guy working didn't even greet us.

reviews.author: Sissy H.
reviews.description: We took a girls day trip to Marble Falls and I put this on my list of places to try. One of my friends had never done a wine tasting and had never really drank wine so I wanted her to have a great first time. Well Laurie made this AWESOME! She took the time with each of us to go over what flavors we liked and made suggestions. She was spot on. Very knowledgeable, warm, friendly and entertaining.  She also shared a map of wineries and distilleries in the area.  We loved the cool, open store/tasting bar. We all walked out with bottles that I know we are going to enjoy.  Great stop on a hot Texas day!

reviews.author: Deepak B.
reviews.description: I'm glad they're open during covid but they're  cheese plate was packaged cream cheese, nothing special about the crackers, definitely not worth $10 not even worth $5 highly do not recommend spend your money somewhere else

reviews.author: Rosi C.
reviews.description: I love this location. Patrice and Elvira are so much fun and they gave us so many tips for our girls Fredericksburg weekend!

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: Me and my fiance came here and did the wine tasting and it was all very delicious!! We ended up taking home the Texas Well Water which is a must try. Not to mention the hospitality was amazing!! Next time we are in town we are definitely coming back!!

reviews.author: Jan M.
reviews.description: Great tasting room in downtown Marble Falls!  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and is willing to give small samples so that you can get a great bottle or glass of wine if you don't want to have a tasting. Rachel, Page, Rhonda and the manager, Patrice go above and beyond to make guests feel very welcome.  Their food is excellent, too!  We were also able to meet the owner during their Grand Opening and learned about the very interesting history of the winery.

reviews.author: Jon-Erik J.
reviews.description: Great new spot in town. My wife and I went for a tasting and it was fantastic.  Great service and nice wine. The Sangiovese is a real winner.  We will be back!  Check it out.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: If you love wine and you're visiting Austin, you should visit Perissos Vineyard.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating that overlook the vineyard.  The grapes used for their wines are locally grown and processed.    Also, if you have a couple hours to spare, then take their Winemaker's Tour and Tasting.  Our tour guide, Greg, is very knowledgeable and he will keep you entertained throughout the entire tour.  My current favorite is their 2018 Racker's Blend which is a mix of all their leftover reds of that season and a close second would be their Malbec.  All their wines are great though!  Overall, a beautiful vineyard with amazing atmosphere and people!  A must go if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Monica Q.
reviews.description: Worth the trip. We are on the wine trail and made a stop here. Very welcoming environment. Everyone was so nice. The view was beautiful. The wine was so yummy. We started with a semi sweet white that I could drink all day and night. They had live music and additional canopies set up for additional shade. It was a beautiful day and had we not been on the wine trail I could hang out here all day.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: Perissos is in a beautiful location in the Texas Hill Country, and it is a good place to get delicious wine and kind, friendly service. I went with my family the week before Christmas, and as the only one doing a tasting (the only drinker), I was able to enjoy wine while they set up a picnic outside in the beautiful setting. The winery has a lot of picnic tables to sit and enjoy among the scenery, which includes a lot of labeled vines. The inside is spacious and tastefully-decorated, and the staff is so nicel I especially loved talking with the blonde from Kentucky - I wish I had gotten her name! My favorite wine was the rosé for sure. I liked it so much that I paused my tasting to enjoy a glass with my lunch, then resumed with the others. I find different places suit my preferences differently, and Perissos is filed in my mind for their rosé. But don't get me wrong - all of their wines are quality, and this place should definitely be on your Hill Country tour!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: Such a wonderful place, awesome service and luxurious wine! We did a wine tasting, lady who poured us was knowledgeable, friendly, welcoming. I told her I like semi-sweet, there were no semisweet wines on there tasting menu but still she poured one instead of wherever there was on a menu and I absolutely loved it, it's like she read my taste:) All the wines on the tasting menu was good, they taste like they describe it. They have few tables outside with shade, it's so calm, peaceful and nice place to enjoy the wine. Will be back soon, Definitely visit this place!

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Visited this winery and it was a pretty great experience. We briefly sampled a couple of wines before buying a bottle (and then another!). The property and the facility are really top notch.  The atmosphere was great. There was seating inside but it was a nice day so we sat in the shade under an oak tree.  Dalton helped us mostly and he steered us in the right direction. Everything we tasted was good. We preferred some wines over others but really didn't have anything bad.  We're looking forward to a return visit!

reviews.author: Brendan E.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time. We've been before and the wine and atmosphere brought us back. Carrie is an absolute treasure and treated us like royalty, giving us a personalized tasting and great recommendations once we moved to glasses. Our experience without Carrie would have been much different. Thankful for her and the excellent service she provided. Definitely make time to stop here!

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery located near Inks Lake State Park. In fact, we came here to unwind after a morning of hiking the state park and it was a lovely place to do a tasting and enjoy the sunny weather. Friendly service, excellent patio/outdoor seating, and a gorgeous interior building. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: OMG !!! Be there or be square. If you like wine; If you like to drink wine; If you want to drink wine in an absolutely gorgeous setting, plan a day to come to Perissos vinyard. We have had the pleasure of visiting vinyards in Tuscany, Italy and this rekindles those memories. It is an easy ride. You enter through the vinyard and arrive at the beautiful tasting building and picnic table area under the live oaks. This has become a family destination for special celebrations, usually birthdays. We usually bring our snacks, sandwiches etc. The tasting room is beautiful. Their wines are world class. We usually purchase bottles of Montepulciano and Temperillo but have sampled others and they are all exceptional. Our usual mode of transportation is our personal vehicles but on one occasion, we rented a limo (Good idea). The place is pooch and kid friendly as well. You will never be disappointed.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We ended up accidentally visiting the same Saturday of their membership wine pickup, so it was really busy! We were lucky that visitors had the option of wine tasting booths outside or buying a glass/bottle inside. Considering it was so busy, their lines moved fairly quickly. Having not been before, we opted to purchase a bottle and relax on the grounds since it was a beautiful day. The bottle was $50 and it was a mediocre wine. Not the best, but not the worst. They might have better options than the one we chose. The setting was beautiful and the guitarist they had playing outside was fantastic. Worth a day trip!

reviews.author: Ross M.
reviews.description: Of all the vineyards in the Hill Country theses folks are the most informative and knowledgeable of any we have been. Granted it is located other than 290 but find it. It is well worth the trip!  Just an excellent experience.

reviews.author: Bryan D.
reviews.description: Excellent experience here yesterday. The wine tasting was very well organized and the wines were very delicious. The Malbec was one of the best Texas Malbecs I have ever tasted. I bought a bottle to bring home.  The charcuterie board was delicious.  Beautiful setting too, got a glass and went outside to enjoy scenery and view.  Great experience and very friendly staff. Highly recommend this winery. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Belinda M.
reviews.description: Amazing experience! Stephanie was an awesome host. Very knowledgeable about their wine/wine. Definitely the best Texas wines we have tasted. A wonderful visit.

reviews.author: Angie C.
reviews.description: I wanted to love the wine based on reviews but unfortunately I did not. Great effort but the prices do not reflect the quality. A good one time visit and purchased a bottle to support small local business. The grounds are lovely and peaceful.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: I have never not loved a winery and the tasting experience... until now. I went with a few girlfriends for a birthday party. We ended up having to wait on another party for almost two hours. They were running late, then had wrong directions... it was a family birthday outing for them as well so we were trying to be gracious but dang... it was over two hours and we only got an ounce of complimentary wine to hold us over. The location is lovely and the live music was great. The winery was packed full of couples, dogs here and there and locals. There was a fun bachelorette group there as well. We finally got started on the pairings and I must say that I literally thought it was a joke. Dorito dust on a piece of shaving of a commercial block of cheese, a tough stale piece of beef jerky that I stuck in my purse and brought home to my dog who had been at home waiting on me for hours and he doesn't turn down anything edible or non edible for that matter but he wanted nothing to do with the pairing jerky. The wine pours were the weakest I've ever tasted. Jeremy was nice but he just didn't bring it. We all left starving and thirsty. We all four agreed that it was a long drawn out one hitter quitter.  The customer service and personable attention just was not there. We finished with a half a mini s'more and were so ready to get back to our weekend lake house and enjoy our own wines and snacks.  I would definitely revamp the tasting menu and be a little bit more generous with the pours, especially if you make a pre paid group of ladies celebrating a birthday wait to get started at 5:30 when we rushed to all get there by 2:45 to start at 3..

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: We were RVing at Lake Bucannon and did a day trip to Perissos Vineyard. This is an exceptional winery! The two gentleman waiting on us outside and were very professional and knowledgeable in explaining about the various wines they had to offer. We ended up spending two hours enjoying the view of the vineyard and several wines. Definitely must go to if you are close to the vineyard.

reviews.author: Bonnie R.
reviews.description: My son surprised his girlfriend this past weekend by proposing at this beautiful winery. The staff were so accommodating on helping us pull off this surprise! My son and future daughter-in-law raved about the staff, the beauty of the winery and the wonderful wine.  Thank you again Perissos!

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: Great wine and great place for COVID-19 .. our wine was 30dlls pricey but Wth is our anniversary  nice view and great atmosphere!!!!

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Perissos exceeded my expectations!! Its my new favorite vineyard in Texas. Out of all Hill Country wineries I've visited, this is most reminiscent of Napa. From literally first moment you drive in, you're surrounded by unending acres of vines. As you venture in, you'll see vineyards galoreandits breathtakingly beautiful. Great photo-op!  LOCATION/ATMOSPHERE: About an hour out from Austin, its close enough for day trip. Its also right by Inks Lake, so take a detour if you want nature too. Tasting room itself is nice- very clean, modern, and country-like with stone walls, wood tablesandindustrial steel chairs. Outside are many picnic tables on a shaded porch or under big trees, so enjoy sipping your wine while looking out at the gorgeous view...nothing like Hill Country! Very laid back.  WINE: Tasting menu is preset ($15 for 6), but offers well-balanced variety. I'm generally not a fan of pre-set menus because there's typically at least a few I will not like. But I loved Perissos' menu and found it to be a strong pre-set (preface: I love wine, specifically dry wine, so my opinion may vary from your palette). All 6 are exceptionally smoothandeasy to drink. Whether light, medium, or full-bodied, my friends and I were thoroughly impressed with each. Each wine is substantial, boasting many wonderful notes. My favorite was the 2015 Racker's Blend. It is made with 8 different redsandpacked with flavor, yet so easy to drink and delightfully smooth with silky long finish. Pours are decent size. All wines 100% Texas grown. Great value tasting!   SERVICE: Excellent! We were immediately greeted by the sweetest lady upon entry. Our server was attentive and came back often to check on us. She was great at not rushing the tasting, letting us enjoy our wine. She also gave detailed descriptions/history of wine before each pour, which I definitely appreciated.  Overall, I absolutely loved Perissos! It is so adorable and perfect escape from the city. I could easily spend the whole afternoon here on a beautiful Texas day...oh wait, I did! Come here for a day-trip getaway and gorgeous views, chill vibes, good wine!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: A good family-owned vineyard, with some fine wines.  All in all a pleasant stop if you're on the Texas wine hunt!  Perissos is located somewhat off the usual 'Texas Wine Trail' along the 290, as it's in Burnet County and relatively isolated from fellow wineries.  Either coming south off 29 or west off 281, the route Park Road 4 is one of the prettiest in Hill Country.   The location is more functional than luxurious, as the tastings take place in a sort of upscale barn-style facility.  However the views off the deck are quite nice and one can see the horses that the family keeps on-site.  Flights cost $15 for six wines on a single pre-selected list.  The selections vary in flavor, and of course YMMV with any recommendation.  But of special mention is their 2015 Fiore Secco, which is a variant of Muscat with notes of ginger and honey.  Also recommended is their cheese plate, which nicely complements their wine.  While I'd have liked some more flexibility in what one could try with a flight, this is a definite recommend so far as a place to try local Texas wine product!

reviews.author: Johna R.
reviews.description: We're wine drinkers (not habitual winery occupants) and loved the Perissos tasting experience.  We walked in on a Sunday afternoon for the $15 tasting and found the grounds beautiful, all the occupants friendly and knowledgeable, and the wine definitely up to our standards.  The tasting included 6 wines (ranging from sweeter white to dry reds) made from Texas-sourced grapes and rather than having you stand at a bar they have table service. The bottles themselves are reasonably priced and the wine club would be a definite investment if we lived a few hours closer.

reviews.author: L.R. L.
reviews.description: Ok, after the COVID pandemic, Trump's departure and the Russian invasion of Ukraine, brothers and sisters, you and me, need a break.  This is THE place.  Great refreshment, great ambiance.    You and I owe having a this vineyard   Live is short, do not wait, go to this fine establishment NOW.

reviews.author: Suley Z.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place! So peaceful and beautiful oak. They have cute dogs here which is a plus. Their wine selection was great. Our host was just great, got 6 tastings for 6. Good wines. Enjoyed every moment of it.

reviews.author: Priya K.
reviews.description: So glad we stumbled upon this beautiful winery while we were visiting the horseshoe Bay Area. Walked in on Sunday afternoon, they took us without reservations. Beautiful outdoor patio seating or you can sit inside. They have 2 tasting menus to choose from for $15 each. Hubby went for the bold reds. They don't have all white tasting but our amazing server let me taste all the sparkling wines which was so fun! The sparkling Chardonnay was my favorite. Hubby's favorite was independence and tandem.  They have charcuterie boards ($25)  or you can bring your own food. We got the charcuterie board and had a great selection of cheese.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I am working on a plan to visit all of the Hill Country wineries at some point. I purchased the Christmas Wine Passport to help me with this in December, and Spicewood was one of the vineyards I passed through. The experience was good. The facilities were beautiful, and it was a peaceful place to chill and relax. I got there shortly after opening, and there was only one other couple there, so I was able to get my tastings quickly and easily. The wines were good, especially their dry sparkling, but I was not moved to come home with anything. The selection I was offered was more heavy on bolder reds, and as a matter of preference I would rather have a good mixutre of reds and whites. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a place I'd cross off my list. Their tempranillos were quite tasty, and I did like their dry sparkling wine.

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: GF and I both came in at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon via a prior RSVP to meet Ron Yates himself and do a full tasting experience with him as our server. This experience was amazing!  The indoor tasting room is large and open, welcoming and chill. Adorned with many award-winning wines of theirs that number beyond what I could count.   We got front-of-house seats together and begin our tasting journey through several whites and reds and sparkling wines. After what had to be 10-12 wines, we honed our picks down to the 'cabernet claret' for my GF and the 'tandem' red for me. However, not one of the wines we tried did we both truly feel we hated or disliked. Normally 1-2 are an easy pass but frankly, every wine we had was very good. My GF prefers sweeter wines across the board so the fact that nearly every wine she had still pleased her was saying something.  Ron was a top-notch host and server for us. His passion and love for wine is all but very clear in his conviction to his craft, knowledge of wine science and methodology, history of the business origins, name creations and labels to the wine bottles... all of it is an adventure with him as the animated storyteller of his wines and how the grapy goodness in the bottle got there and what you can expect to experience when it hits your lips.  I have to mention that they host an annual chili cook-off event every last Saturday of Feb with live music, 15+ chili contenders, and wine tasting all day long. It's their most successful event to date each year. When he spoke of that I made plans to be there for that for sure!  Ron and the team have a solid handle on this wine thing that is for darn sure! We only barely looked over the vineyard grounds so next time we come back, its gonna be charcuterie board, wine and time out in the vines for sure!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Upon arrival at this gem a couple years ago, we had our doubts. The few Texas wines we had tried were subpar in our view. Spicewood's offerings opened a whole new chapter in our wine lifestyle upon completing that first visit.  When we first entered their tasting room, we noticed a plethora of wine award medallions on display. Being a volunteer on the Houston Rodeo, I was especially pleased to see many Rodeo Houston awards. But that wasn't all - Spicewood has awards from wine contests all around the country! Hmmmmm...  As we proceeded through our tasting, we were immediately impressed. Texas wine? This good? Yes, indeed! So good, in fact, that I joined their wine club without hesitation and remain a member to this day.   We visited again yesterday and enjoyed complimentary tastings of six nice wines and picked up our wine club orders from the past couple of quarters. We sat on their patio overlooking the vineyard and remarked how we are so happy to have found this spot. Oh, and the people working here are gracious and genuinely friendly.  Spicewood is a tad off the beaten path, but definitely worth the trek.

reviews.author: Mop P.
reviews.description: Out of the way a bit but worth it. Staff treats each guest like their experience is important. We came out on a Sunday morning got a couple of tables for our family and did the $15 tasting--6 pours but all around 14% Alcohol. Most are only sold on site from what I heard.  Great for families. Nice slow pace; bring whatever food you want they welcome it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I've visited many Texas Hill Country vineyards and this place was just okay. Sure, the tasting is cheap but the wine was nothing to leave me desiring more. Atmosphere and scenery itself was also nothing to boast about. Sorry, not for me. Pass.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: As long time Spicewood Vineyard members we always enjoy our trips to the vineyard On this visit we brought our two sons and his family for a picnic at the vineyard. Of course things were a little different with Covid going on but everything was spaced out and carefully planned out for everyone's safety. When we arrived Ron was in the porch helping the guests with their wine selections. He is always very nice and makes everyone feel at home. It's always nice when the owner with everything he has to do remembers your names. After our picnic we got to sit in the Wine Cellar which was awesome. Highly recommend visiting, enjoying the scenery and trying out all the great tasting wines.   Hats off to Ron and Crew!   Adrian and Cyndi

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: This premier Texas Vineyard has been around for 20 years now. Their customer service is excellent and their wines are some of the best in Texas.

reviews.author: Michae A.
reviews.description: This review is based on their $15 tasting menu which is a great deal for 7 wines.   We love wine and enjoy going to new areas to try tastings so was really excited to try this place based on their reviews but my husband and I were sadly disappointed.   I will say however that they do have an option for an estate tasting that goes for $30 which could be amazing but we decided to pass on it.

reviews.author: Layle M.
reviews.description: Hmm...it has taken me over a week because I hate to say something bad about someone's business. Last Monday we stopped here after a fantastic visit to Marble Falls. We felt...tolerated...at best. We were met by 3 huge dogs who barked incessantly upon our arrival and throughout the visit. When the host finally came out he didn't offer up options for the tastings like we've experienced at other wineries. I'm pretty clear on what I like and had some ideas of wines I'd like to try with the intent of buying enough bottles to make a case of assorted bottles upon departing. The owner, who has great reviews on Yelp, either wasn't there or was busy. We didn't see this person. But we pushed through the tasting, cut it a bit short, and left much, much sooner than we'd ever imagined we would. My intuition upon arrival was to just leave. We should have done that.  This is our experience. And it just wasn't pleasant. We were the only guests yet felt we were in the way.  Hopefully, for others, their visits will be more aligned with this place's other more positive reviews.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I was pleasantly surprised by Spicewood Vineyards.  Spicewood was originally founded by the Manigolds.  Their vision was to make wine only from estate grown grapes. They were smart when they planted their vineyard.  They analyzed the soil and only planted grape varieties that would thrive in their soil.  Nine of the original 17 acres planted by the Manigolds are still producing fruit. For Texas that means something. That means wine sourced from grapes growing on vines that are now 24 plus years old.  Ron Yates took over from the Manigolds and is now the owner of Spicewood, and with wine maker Todd Crowell is making some good Texas sourced wines.  They now have thirty two acres planted on site, and partner with other Texas grape growers.    I like that the tasting room is a bit off the common path. That means it is away from the hustle and bustle of other Hill Country wineries.  The tasting room is spacious.  It has a homey lodge like feeling that is very inviting. They also have a beautiful tree shaded outdoor space.    The staff here are like family. They are knowledgeable and friendly.  I tasted through a selection of their vast options available. I found them to be well balanced.  Surprisingly I liked their Sauvignon blanc along with other of their wines.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: We love this place. Wine and service is always good. Pretty awesome place to hang out for an afternoon. They have live music sometimes also

reviews.author: Lance M.
reviews.description: My experience was a 4-5 like many of those you will see here. However, our lovely day was ruined when one of the resident dogs or a customer's dog charged us aggressively while I was walking with my 10 month old baby in my arms. I cannot be sure if it was a resident dog or a guest's dog, but it was one of the gray colored Blue Lacey's).  Regardless, the dog was unprovoked by us. I had to hand my baby to my wife while I tried to protect them from this aggressive dog, hair bristled up and darting in at me aggressively as if to bite. Luckily it didn't bite us. The dogs owner chastised me for reacting strongly in defense of my wife and baby, which really frustrated me. We immediately left and I will not be returning. I wanted to post this in case a child is attacked by a dog on their premises in the future. It is documented and the owners have been informed that their aggressive dog or lack of leash laws are creating a liability and awful experience.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: I'm badly remiss in not posting a positive review for almost a year; what's more this is one of my personal favorite wineries in Texas Hill Country.  It's time I corrected this.   Spicewood has one of my personal favorite tasting rooms; while on the inside it's nothing special, the outside grounds and seating mimic an upscale, modern country house that I could see myself living in (*cough cough* once I win the lottery *cough cough*).  There's also a cool little stream they have running through the place so you can hear the sound of running or falling water when you sit to have a sip.  Nice touch.  Spicewood's won a bunch of awards for various wines but the two standouts IMO are their 2013 Syrah and their Riesling, which has a fruity taste and a magnificent green-apple crisp bouquet.  Note: As of May 2016, their site does not show the Riesling for sale, so I'd call ahead if you want to taste it.  As an added bonus, it's only 10 minutes away from It's All Good and Opie's, both of whom have some of my favorite BBQ outside the Austin area.

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This is better wine and value compared to Stone house winery.  It is $10 for seven tastings and only one wine was not from Texas. They have indoor and outdoor seating. There is no view at this vineyard. Staff is friendly. There was a friendly house dog wandering around.  They have t shirts for sale.

reviews.author: Jenn M.
reviews.description: I only put a one because it isn't there anymore. We drove 20 minutes to it and it was closed, I'm assuming. Darn.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: The Good Guy. Wow. It's an excellent red wine. It's smooth and tasty. It's not cheap. It's $42. I couldn't care less. I'll pay for wine as long as it's delicious and this one is fabulous. I like the patio outside. You can bring your dog and  kids if you'd like. The ambience inside and out is relaxing and fun. It's an excellent place to chill out with loved ones. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a broad range of varietals for producing their many wines.  Some are very surprising like their Tempranillo Rose, Mourvedra, Cab, and Pinot.   Since they seemed to blend grapes from outside of Texas with estate, gives their wines a different character than most I've tasted from Calif and Washington for the same grape varietal.    For non-wine items to consider, the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, dog friendly, indoor and outdoor seating with a nice babbling brook adjacent.   They do have an event facility and would make a nice venue for any type of occasion.  They have a hearty cheese plate that won't disappoint.  I would not use the spicy cheese however.

reviews.author: Joan M.
reviews.description: Hidden gem for brick oven pizza Italian style. Quiet, great place for a girls luncheon.

reviews.author: Danny G.
reviews.description: Horrible Loud Angry service! Too much employee hostility  Danny and Kathryn Glenn   Northlake, TX

reviews.author: Jacob T.
reviews.description: Our waitress was really outstanding, and the ambiance is very nice - great decor and a quiet atmosphere.  We ordered the ciabatta appetizer and it was really great, especially the vinegar they offered to dip it in.  It's just regular balsamic vinegar but however they make it, it's really great (they have bottles for sale you can take with you).  We also sampled a few of their wines and they were all excellent.  My wife and I split a caesar salad and the Enoteca pizza.  There was nothing particularly outstanding about the salad - it was exactly what you'd expect.  The pizza was a huge letdown.  It had lots of ingredients on it but still somehow didn't have a lot of flavors.  The crust was very thin and crunchy, which we loved, but overall we were very let down.  We took a bottle of the vinegar and an extra bottle of wine home with us, because they were so good, and we still spent under $100 on the whole meal.  I think we'll probably give this place another try in the future but we'll be avoiding the pizza.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: When we made the reservation they warned us they were short staffed and there would be a wait.  Well they did a phenomenal job with their short staff!  Service and food were outstanding!  We all loved our dish and our waitress was very attentive!  I only had a chance to take a picture of my food which was the Chilean Sea-bass, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brenda R.
reviews.description: We chose the Truffle Parmesan Avacado, it was delicious and the avocados..so fresh.  We had never had this or heard of it and it was delicious. We also had a very nice waiter...shout out to Noe so pleasant and always smiling.

reviews.author: Amy M.
reviews.description: Love this place! Amazing food and wine and a lovely dog-friendly outdoor patio. The wood fired pizzas are delicious, especially the L'Enoteca.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: The food was anything but good .... We left there feeling like they don't care because they don't count on you returning.  So we won't. The flat bread had no rise to it but it was covered with so much cornmeal. The pizza was the same dough was  too much cheese along we other Japanese mushroom. The cheese is not fresh mozzarella... And canned olives.   No drinks one pizza one simple green salad  Plain flat bread to start one dessert 50.00. Oh by the way bring cash they don't allow to tip on the card...

reviews.author: Joanie A.
reviews.description: WONDERFUL! The most sophisticated food in Marble Falls! Our service was impeccable- a very nice waitress who was attentive throughout the meal from the beginning to the end. Avocado wrapped with cheese was great, as well as as a shrimp lemon pasta dish. Everything except the bacon wrapped dates. I think the bacon wrapped dates would have been enjoyed if we expected date paste, rather than whole stuffed dates as we are accustom to being served as an appetizer.   Our wine was $49 a bottle.  Unfortunately, it had much too much sentiment and was not the best wine.  I am not familiar with the pricing of Texas wines, but basically for fine restaurant, it was not as nice as the decor, service or food. Yes we plan on going back!

reviews.author: Ms C.
reviews.description: We've had a lakehouse in Marble Falls for over 35 years. I'm not sure how long Flat Creek has been here, but it is by far my favorite restaurant. The wines have begun to sing...they are really coming into their own. The Syrah is one of my favorites. The menu changes frequently and I like that. I'm usually tempted by one of the entrees, but I typically end up with one of the pizzas. They are always delicious. Piping hot out of the pizza oven with a crispy crust. My boyfriend had the sea bass and he said it was delicious. We had another great night and look forward to our next visit.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: We visited the Enoteca (what?) not really knowing what we were in for, and we are glad we did.  The wood-fired margarita pizza was fresh and delicious, accompanied by a baked Brie with fruit and marmalade which was fantastic.  But the real surprise was the Flat Creek Cabernet Sauvignon, a Texas wine that really delivers.  Final word?  We came back the next night for the filet mignonette and salmon.  My wife loved the salmon and the filet was cooked to perfection, one of the best, most tender I've ever enjoyed.  Noah did a great job taking care of us and the proprietor, Rick, was a pleasure to meet and chat with.  Highly recommend!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: Great pizza and house salad. Pizza crust was light and flaky. Toppings were fresh and service was fast. Lovely atmosphere and spacious. House salad was fresh with house made dressing. Nothing out of the bottle.  Our favorite place for date night.

reviews.author: Natasha M.
reviews.description: All the food was yummy and the service was great. Wish it were a sunny day - would have taken our pup on the patio.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Hey, you know how the line at Bluebonnet Cafe sucks? Walk 20 feet over to this hidden gem instead!  Flat Creek is a strangely fascinating find. The exterior looks like a 1970's strip mall. The parking lot is cracked and disjointed, with room for perhaps 10 cars. To call it unassuming would be an understatement. Hell, even the website bills it as "an urban wine bar."  And yet, the food here is incredible. Flat Creek is actually an extension of their winery, located North of Lake Travis, just off 1431. Is the wine good? Hell if I know. It looks fancy. They have a private tasting room and a really high tech looking chiller thing. What I can say, definitively, is that they're serious about both their wine and their food.   We started with the blue fig flatbread, which was well balanced and fairly large for an appetizer. So much so, that between a party of three, we couldn't finish it off.  For the table, we then ordered crab cakes, the sausage and mushroom pizza, and an avocado truffle salad. The pizza was the clear winner here, crispy crust, not-too-salty toppings, and a strangely addictive sauce. My wife gave the crab cakes a big "meh" and proceeded to help herself to more pizza. The avocado salad was really fresh avocado slices wrapped in crispy Parmesan cheese. Delicious, but very, very rich, and the side salad was necessary just to balance the dish. We finished the meal with a lovely light pear dessert.  Downsides? The service was friendly, but glacial. When we entered we were 1 of 2 tables in the entire place, and when we left we were 1 of 2 tables in the entire place. In between there were quite a few "haha, okay, but really, where is our server?" moments. If you don't favor wine, you're not going to find much else to imbibe. I get it, it's a wine bar, just be forewarned.   Seriously though, next time you're stuck in line at Bluebonnet, send a wayward glance across the street to Flat Creek Enoteca, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

reviews.author: Penny M.
reviews.description: The L 'Enoteca pizza was delicious!  Glad we went with our waiter's recommendation.  Caprese Salad was good too.

reviews.author: Lindsay T.
reviews.description: Visiting the area and hadn't been overly impressed w the restaurants in the area. Found Flat Creek Enoteca and really enjoyed it! The filet and pasta were great and so was the service! Also we enjoyed the Reserve Super Texan wine which is local to the area. I'd def recommend!

reviews.author: Hailey D.
reviews.description: Wow. This was incredibly disappointing. This is supposed to be a tasting room and restaurant for the Flat Creek Winery. We went there to - hopefully - do a tasting, buy a few bottles of wine to take back with us, and have dinner.  This is kind of one of our things ... we enjoy visiting vineyards or sampling rooms and tasting and buying nice wines.  To start out, the parking out front isn't the greatest. For some reason several people had parked over the lines taking up two spots, which made it even more difficult to park.   We ordered a flight of reds. The Super Texan was flat. We thought that the bottle they served us from had been open and sitting around for too long. It was definitely showing signs oxidation as colour was shifting to brownish from red. (Why did a tasting room serve a flat glass of wine?)   The next wine in the flight was Montepulciano.  Eh. It tasted slightly flat and had a funky smell - sort of wet dogish.   The final glass was Barbera. Actually this was crisp and tasted good, so we ordered a full glass to enjoy.  We ordered a gluten-free cheese board with our flights. Warning: if you are gluten-free, dine here at your own peril. (We believe if you offer gluten-free, know what is and how to do it.)  The kitchen is open to the tasting room and dining room. We saw the male chef remove wheat-based crackers off our cheese board and put supposedly gluten-free flatbread triangles onto that same plate and send it out to us. When we pointed out that the entire board was now contaminated and we couldn't eat this due to cross-contamination, he seemed perturbed with us.  They offered to remake the cheese board. It took forever. We had finished our flights and had ordered a glass of the Barbera. The male chef (?) put the "new" order of flat bread into the pizza oven with the wheat-based items. (Thank goodness my spouse was watching and caught this.) He seemed to not understand that you cannot put gluten-free items in the same oven with wheat based items. IDK why, but it was a fiasco. ‍  The young boy that sat us was very shy and seemed not to understand us; we originally asked for a table, but he asked if we had reservations. No. Did we need reservations? No. (There were empty tables and this week is apparently slow for the resorts and restaurants.) Well, we'd like to have dinner. (Looking at empty dinner tables.) Can we have a table in the dining area? Do you want to sit at the high-top or a regular table? We'd prefer a regular table. Do you want to sit at a high-top or a regular table? The third time we answered that we guessed we'll sit at the high top. And that's where we were seated. Mhmmm   Our server, Anna, was good. She was trying to get the cheese board delivered properly; she knew enough to suggest that the Superbly Italian flight wines would be less dry than the Fireside Reds flight.  Our impression was that the staff here are not pros trained and experienced in hospitality. Disappointing. We decided that the getting seated and the corked and flat wine combined with the cheese board "not gluten-free" experience was enough and left to find a better dining experience elsewhere.   For my spouse and I the bill came to $72.  We each had one flight of 3 wines, shared a cheese board, and had a single glass of the Barbera each.  Pricing is typical for this combination of items at a dating rooms, but the wines were not. Disappointing.

reviews.author: Kelsey K.
reviews.description: Looked for a nice Italian wine place in Marble Falls. This place did not disappoint! The wine was great but the food was wonderful. Came out fast and so hot that it took a minute to eat. Very good, very fresh.

reviews.author: Doug G.
reviews.description: Very good dinner. We had a bottle of Syrah from Flat Creek.  We decided to mix it up and so ordered two different flat breads, one cheesy and one creek.  We also had the lemon cauliflower and Brussels sprouts.  My wife ordered a terimisu to go.  Wine and food were both good.

reviews.author: Julie A.
reviews.description: Excellent wines and very good food.  Really enjoyed the wood-grilled salmon. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Not sure what happened when we went, took my wife here for her birthday thinking wine and dinner at a local place. I think perhaps they are struggling with employees, as everyone is, so extra stars for that. For us the pizza was a 2 a s filet mignon was a 3. I think there were maybe 10 to 15 people seated and it was stressful.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: Yesterday, I decided to do a day trip to Spicewood today. It was first to Krause Springs then found out Iron Wolf would be open lunch time. After a refreshing morning at Krause Springs, we headed to Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery for lunch and drinks.   They have a wide variety of spirits with several award winning ones. Tiann was great in making our drinks! I had the New Fashion made with Hotscotch (a little sweet and spicy). My husband had the Luna-tic made with vodka and several fruit juices. We enjoyed the drinks while we waited for our lunch from Craigo's. We ordered the specialty pizza (sausage, pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onions) and barbecue wings. Truly phenomenal pizza and wings! We also had the Giddy Up Mary with horseradish-infused vodka and Wild and Tea, an Arnold Palmer with bourbon.   We'll have to come back another time for the tasting and meet Luna, a wolf adopted by the family (she's usually there on Fridays). Most Saturdays they have live music. Definitely check their calendar online.

reviews.author: Monica Q.
reviews.description: We just did a tasting and I was not expecting that . It was so yummy. Very friendly people. Nice at home atmosphere. We really enjoyed the group tasting. It was fun hanging with everyone and hear what people like and have trouble drinking . We had vodka, gen, bourbon, scotch, etc. and we ended up leaving with a bottle of Hot iron. Can't wait to get home and have a glass of this in ice.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Made the trek for a friend's Bday get together. A little off the beaten path but worth the drive.   Beautiful venue. Plenty of seating under the oaks. Playground. Disc golf. Cornhole. Food truck (Craig O's). We had a great time.   Specialty cocktails are a little off (and a little weak). Order your preferred cocktail and you'll be fine.   Didn't do the tour or tasting. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I mean what's really hard? It's liquor and a open space. That's all you really need to have a perfect distillery. The service was great and the staff were nice. I would recommend the bourbon and the gin because they were both smooth and delicious. This is definitely a chill and relaxing place to visit

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This place is not set up to be a serious event venue. They have ONE indoor bathroom and a lousy pizza truck. They might be an ok distillery, but I don't know, that's not what I was there for.

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: I almost don't wana leave such a positive review because then more and more people will find out about this AMAZING spot and I want it all for myself!! Hahaha kidding but really this place was awesome, even though it was a day with drizzle still enjoyed it! First off the staff is beyond sweet, so warm and welcoming! The drinks were great and good price! Such a fun vibe with good music. Very mellow way to spend a Sunday afternoon. So happy they had a kids area because both my 8 year old and 2 year old had a blast and stayed busy so I could enjoy a delicious Bloody Mary. They have awesome lawn games to keep busy and a delicious pizza food truck parked on site. We will for sure be back!! Do yourself a favor and pay it a visit it was a lot better than most of the distilleries I've visited.

reviews.author: Ken G.
reviews.description: Stopped by here with some local friends, and it definitely was the best spot we went to of the whole night. The bourbon was awesome!!! They had a little fair going on, and that made the whole experience even better. Live music as well! If they had rooms we would have stayed. Haha. Definitely recommend stopping by this spot. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Sepid M.
reviews.description: We got stock there during a storm and they were the best! People are so nice and the drinks are awesome!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Great distillery! I'm actually not typically a whiskey fan but I like theirs! Love both the Hotscotch and Iron Hot.  Plentiful parking. Big outdoor deck seating. Live music stage. Food truck on site. Awesome Hill Country views.  Family-friendly events. Highly recommend Iron Wolf!

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: This is the fanciest metal building distillery I have ever seen!  Very shiny stainless steel still, immaculate polished concrete floors, easily the fanciest metL building I have seen!    And they have good liquor!  The tasting is informative and interesting, even if all of the idetails on the fancy bottles is a bit overwhelming.  But the real wolf is interesting.   Try it al!!  The Giddy'Up (horseradish) vodka is better than it sounds - and it makes a fantastic Bloody Mary!  Several things were good, but you must BUY this - it is excellent!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: We were excited to go here. That quickly faded. There is almost no shade. I'm sorry but this is Texas. It's hot. You need to put in adequate shade. It has one indoor bathroom and one little pizza truck -which the pizza was Okay- the kids play area is huge tires with again NO shade. Please don't even say you have a play area when the only thing they could climb on are tires that would give them second degree burns. The solo artist singing was probably the only good thing as we also got 3 different drinks and didn't even finish half of it because it was gross.

reviews.author: Christina D.
reviews.description: We stopped by here as one of our stops during a brewery/wine tour. It became our last stop, the owners were super friendly and attentive to us the whole time. We started out with a tasting and even though the weather was not in our favor we still enjoyed our time around the fire enjoying their great drink options. It's a pet friendly family atmosphere and we will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Molly F.
reviews.description: I have visited Iron Wolf many times and never had a bad experience! Staff is very friendly and hospitable. Great environment and drinks! Must try the Hotscotch liquor!

reviews.author: Alyse H.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this sprawling alcohol paradise on our drive back to Austin from San Angelo.  We originally stopped because the BBQ food truck they have on the premises is rated very high, but the liquor turned out to be the real star. Hubby partook in a liquor tasting that cost $10 for multiple samples.  They have some very unique flavors that I've never heard of anyone incorporating in a liquor before.  I ordered a bourbon and lemonade drink that hit the spot in the Texas heat.  This was a Mecca for bachelorette parties and large groups of friends.  There is plenty of room on the property to spread out and enjoy the weather.  They also host concerts on their stage next to the tasting room.  They are planning to expand their offerings here, so stay tuned as to what they build!

reviews.author: Laura V.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite place to visit in the Hill Country. It is a party place. Large group specialty. Large area. Room to spread. Dog friendly. Great patios and food trucks. We had the Ginirita and Cucumber Cooler. We Tasted the butterscotch Vodka and bourbon and the rum. Everything was superb. My Fav Place.

reviews.author: Brian A.
reviews.description: Amazing place and people, family friendly even your Pup can come out and enjoy!  Recommend this place!

reviews.author: Missy L.
reviews.description: This is an amazing venue!  The family is so kind and attentive to all of their patrons.  We have been coming here since they've opened, and enjoy every single minute!  It's a must try!!

reviews.author: Prince H.
reviews.description: I'm rounding up to 5 stars because it is a family run business working hard to make a go of it. Small but nice distillery has tours and tastings with a large outdoor area for hanging out and a stage for occasional music acts. I didn't play but the frisbee golf looked great.  Rum, gin, fireball, and few other mixed spirits to sample.  I personally liked and purchased the gin. Low juniper the way I like it.  Odd wild eye logo is off putting but very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Jani C.
reviews.description: Great place - live music   Nice outdoor area with games and food trucks. The owners are very nice . Be sure and do the tasting so you can see how good the bourbon- vodka- gin - etc is

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery is a welcome new addition to the ever quickly expanding distillery scene in the Texas Hill Country.  The owners are a wonderful husband and wife team that we had the pleasure to chat with for awhile during our visit.  We visited soon after their opened, and I have been trying to find a chance to get back ever since.  When you drive up to the tasting room and production site you immediately know this is a special spot.  Their 15 acre property has been planned and well thought out.  The current building, known as the "Still House", is just one of several future buildings that they have envisioned to have onsite.  The "Still House" provides space for onsite production and a tasting room. They also have expansive space surrounding the building for the whole family to come out and enjoy.  They have huge oaks shading the property.  Elevated decks with cozy seating and beautiful 360 views. A fire pit, bocci ball green, human size beer pong, washers, horse shoes, and a 9 disc golf course.  Did I also mention the amazing sand box for the kids!  You could easily pack a picnic and make a day of it here.    For a nominal fee you can taste a selection of their spirits, or just purchase a crafted cocktail.  Their spirit options are Gin, Rum, Vodka, and Horseradish infused Vodka.  They also have two flavored Whiskeys - Iron Hot, which is a Whiskey with all natural cinnamon and sweeteners blended with Texas peppers. I saved the best for last. Their Hotscotch, which is Whiskey blended with natural butterscotch flavors and Texas Peppers.  It is sweet meets spicy.  All the spirits were well done. But Hotscotch was my favorite. Something unique.  I have enjoyed it in my apple cider!    A fantastic space, with great drinks, and awesome people. It doesn't get much better than this.  It will be great too see how this place grows and expands in the future.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.   This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.   From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery.  * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery.  * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly.  * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery.  * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

reviews.author: Scott A.
reviews.description: I had had this resort on my list of places to go for a couple of years. Unfortunately the quality of service was not up to my expectations.  Now to be fair it's very challenging time to hire and properly train servers and staff. However some very simple things could have made the stay more enjoyable.  360 bar - This restaurant / bar offers a good atmosphere and a fun place to gather.  This is where the staffing was the biggest concern or issue. I got up to get a menu off the bar and someone cleared our table including our drinks that were just ordered. I'm a fairly patient person but this was unacceptable because I left the table for about 1 minute. I asked the person why did you clear our table we haven't ordered yet. His response was "we close in 40 minutes."  Inside restaurant - best service but when our food was up in the window (which I learned to keep an eye on) I couldn't find a server to bring our food to the table. The cook started pouring on more sweet potato fries on to try to keep the plated ones warm!   Pool staff - utterly clueless Now I didn't think it was possible for a resort to run out of pool towels late in the season..... but they found a way. The drinks they make are ok, but I haven't found a better margarita than my own.   When I had a long conversation with a manager named Michael, I was more frustrated than when I started with him. In one ear and out the other ear (he didn't seem to care about our issues during the stay).  Golf courses are amazing, that's the part that brings people back. Excellent service inside the golf shops and golf courses are in excellent condition.

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: My daughter and I had a delightful stay at the hotel at Horseshoe Bay Resort starting on Labor Day afternoon 2021. Horseshoe Bay Resort is a 7,000-acre AAA Four Diamond resort about 45 minutes from Austin in the Texas Hill Country. We had such a great time and it was a perfect time to be there. It's a beautiful resort! With all the palm trees and beautiful vegetation, it seemed like I was in a tropical paradise instead of Texas.  We ate at several of their restaurants, which were all great: Yacht Club, J's Restaurant, Slick Rock Grill, and Whitewater 360 Sports Club.  We really enjoyed their lovely beach on the lake with an ample choice of nice lounge chairs and beach umbrellas. We also enjoyed the Yacht Club Pool near the Marina. They took reservations, so the number of people using the pool was always small. There were also other pools available.  At the Marina, they had wave-runners, canoes, and boats available for a fee.   There were also bicycles available with no fee.   We very much enjoyed so many amenities at Horseshoe Bay Resort.  They also had a great spa and FOUR beautiful 18 hole golf courses! In addition to the lovely hotel rooms, they had villas and homes that could be  rented.  With so many acres of fun, it was wonderful that they gave shuttle rides anywhere on the property with a simple phone call...golf carts, Suburbans, and vans were always available on the property.  The staff were all very helpful and so friendly!  We had such a great stay at Horseshoe Bay Resort!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Before deciding on this resort, we had already checked into two different hotels on this day only to check back out. The reason was because their mattresses were badly stained with urine and poor quality bedding. Before staying at any hotel, you should always pull back the sheets and mattress cover to see just what you're really getting into. The bed in our room at this resort had a mattress that was like new and the bedding was perfectly clean.  Upon checking in, Jimmy was extremely helpful and gave us a fantastic rate. Now for the pros: The room was well furnished with a large flat screen, a mini fridge and a good size closet. The bathroom was equally well crafted with a nice shower and had good hot water pressure.  The curtains that cover the balcony door were excellent at keeping out direct sunlight. There is a nice restaurant called J's in the lobby of which you can find separate reviews on yelp. There is also a nice small coffee shop downstairs with some fresh baked goods. It is quite obvious they have poured some serious money into this place especially as you walk the grounds. Everywhere you look there are fountains, rivers and waterfalls along with meticulously cared for gardens. There are also numerous tennis and pickle ball courts, so bring your gear. There's even one of the most beautiful putting courses I've ever seen. There is a very nice outdoor pool and a fairly sizable hot tub, so make sure to bring your bathing suit.  If I could change anything about our stay, I would add a ceiling fan to the room and a microwave. We were going to use the hot tub, but after testing the waters we found that it just was not hot enough for our liking. That aside, this was definitely one of the nicest places we've ever stayed at and we will definitely be back

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: I really struggled on this review. I'm going to start with the positive: - we received a free room upgrade because it was our honeymoon - the massages at the spa were wonderful, but the pool wasn't open - The staff working is very helpful and attentive   The negatives: - our first meal here was dinner at Jay's and I got food poisoning, which ruined our entire honeymoon - A lot of the drink machines are broke - I sent management an email regarding the food poisoning and have been completely ignored, but the banquet manger helped us while we were there - food is pricey.. very pricey  - I wish there was an adults only pool or area. If there was one, I couldn't find it. I made reservations at the Yacht Club because I thought it was adults only. We got there 5 minutes after our 3:30pm reservation and it was packed. I don't think the reservation times are enforced  - we waited 20 min for someone to come up and help us with our luggage. We finally decided not to wait anymore. They actually brought our car around without us asking, so we were late to our Spa appointment.  In all. It was mediocre. Some positives and negatives. But getting food poisoning and being completely ignored from management left a sour taste in our mouth. We probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: If your going to stay at this property and plan to use their amenities I would call ahead and make sure they are available. I stool the family there for a quick getaway and to use the amazing looking pools featured all over their website and booking site but upon arrival was told that all pools are under major renovation. Restaurants had extremely limited menus and the hotel staff was not very welcoming and friendly. A hotel that classifies them self as a resort with no amenities is not really a resort.

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Service is seriously lacking! I don't care that's it off season.  1st we ask about a restaurant and they recommend a pizza restaurant within the resort and they don't mention that it's closed the next two days. Everything about dinner in J's was slow the last straw was we ordered apple pie 25 minutes later still no apple pie no hint from the waitress as to why we don't have it she never came out to even say it was going to be late. She did come running when I was walking out of the restaurant before signing my check!   Terrible terrible overall experience.

reviews.author: S. T.
reviews.description: We visited this place about a year ago and had a far better experience than we did recently. So I'm here writing an update. Rung in 2022 at HB, hoping for another fantastic time. We enjoyed the complimentary wine and cookies upon arrival in 2021. At that time, enjoyed all meals at J's Restaurant-breakfast, lunch, and dinner. No refreshments were given this time and was disappointed by J's meal options. The lunch and dinner menus were very similar. Salads, bar foods and sandwiches are fine for lunch, but not as a repeat for dinner (a slight variation was made). 2021 dinners were hearty and comfort-type foods. We loved the dinner last year at The Yacht Club, so much so, bragged about it, and made sure we made reservations again. For us, (good) food is LIFE, and was what brought us back again.
