Robert was very accommodating, professional, and had awesome rates. He called two days before the scheduled time of arrival to check in and verify everything was still good to go. He asked if there were any changes in the amount of people and offered a bigger bus just in case. Our drivers, Patrick and Joe were awesome! Patrick called me early the day of to verify everything and let me know he'd be there at 8 and then called again when they were almost to our pickup location. They arrived right on time with an awesome bus just for us. He had coolers with ice, a flat screen tv, music system, AC and even a bathroom in the back. What more could you ask for? Part of the evening was spent at Graham's Central Station in Pville. We didn't realize prior that Graham's doesn't serve food anymore and had to order pizza to the bus. Patrick gladly retrieved our pizza and brought it to us when it arrived. We all had a blast, felt safe and were taken care of. Highly recommend Austin NItes and shout out to Patty PartyWagon, if you had a Yelp page, I'd write a review for you too.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: WARNING: We had a tight deadline to get to Lake Travis and the bus driver was 30 minutes late.  We had to take another bus or risk missing our charter.  He verbally offered to refund my money for his tardiness and then kept my funds and would not return them.  Now I am fighting to get those funds back.  LOOK ELSEWHERE.

reviews.author: Vinny P.
reviews.description: Great service! We did a brewery and distillery tour with Cool Bus ATX yesterday. Sam is the owner/driver and one thing she provides is unbelievable customer service. She's extremely easy to work with, provides a fun atmosphere on the bus and is very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this service to anyone who's looking to get a group of friends together and tour around Austin.

reviews.author: Edwin T.
reviews.description: We had a 12 man bachelor party in Austin during Memorial Day weekend. The day we spent riding around in Cool Bus ATX was the absolute highlight of the weekend. Sam, the owner and driver, was unbelievable. Very accommodating, great driver, and super chill.   We planned to hit up the Salt Lick on the party bus and then venture around to some breweries afterwards. Sam made sure that the group got where we needed to be on time, had great suggestions for breweries, and made sure we were having as much fun as possible.  The bus is great. Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful time!  As a bachelorette "day party," we gathered together and hopped in the super roomy and comfortable All About Central Texas SUV and headed out on our journey.   Kim is extremely knowledgeable about each winery; the history, the best wines to try, the "wine club" or other bonus things each winery has.   We stopped in on 3 different wineries and Kim had made superb choices in each spot; from the wines to the view to the suggestions on what to try and how to make the most of our samples so everyone could try as many as possible (thanks for that tip, Kim!).   Be it an afternoon with a group of friends, or a romantic day for two, All About Central Texas is an outstanding choice.  Thanks for everything, Kim!

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: All about Central Texas was really great- Kim was so knowledgeable about the area and had great info on wine and Texas! I did the Fredericksburg tour and based on my wine preferences she had some great suggestions on which ones to stop in, there are so many! I even joined a wine club, the tastings were informative and she is just a lot of fun and I didn't have to worry about driving or directions and could enjoy the pours and some snacks.  I highly recommend All abt Central Texas tours, they are personable, you can really get to meet the others in these small groups- Thanks so much!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Save the world brewing is filled with the happiest and most passionate staff! The beers were all great, especially the coco lux!  Our only constructive feedback is that there was a huge crowd of people and lines to get beer were very long. Chatting with other customers in line, we wondered if the two other windows could be turned into ordering stations (where there is only one ordering window outside now).  LOVE the philanthropic edge!  Also love the family friendly environment with games and playscape.

reviews.author: Les F.
reviews.description: This is SO MUCH MORE than a brewing company.  It is THE social gathering place of the Texas Hill Country. Yep.  Folks come to visit or become members from Austin, Spicewood, Bertram, Burnet, Lampasas, Horseshoe Bay, San Antonio, Johnson City, Blanco and Kingsland and . . . . . .  When vaca/day-cationers are nearby, they love to stop in here as they, like everyone else, are treated like valued-friends and family.  Dr. Qyuinh and Dr. David (two early-retired physicians) will remember you after one visit and so will many of the others they attract - staff AND guests.     Now, about their ales.  If you don't find one you love, you don't like ales.  Even my wife, who does NOT like beer, told that to Qyuinh and guess what?  Qyuinh told her she'd find one she likes.  Now she likes TWO; so she has choices!  My Favs are the Scotch Ale (Bonus Pastor) Bo (Belgian style double milk chocolate stout with Vietnamese cold brew coffee and hazelnuts).  Check out their menu at https://savetheworldbrewing.com/ .     As we are members, we get a free pour with every new release (every couple weeks). And with our membership we get our own autographed glass which they keep for us and provide sterile drinks when we're there.  Also with our membership we get a free kool T-shirt.  Yes!  We get another with each annual renewal.       Oh, and did I mention ALL their profits go to charity?  The tip jar goes to local charities, like Habitat projects, or The Crisis Center.  And their profits go to charities across the world, like to the victims of military coups in Africa or flood victims in New Orleans.  When the C-19 Pandemic hit NYC, they sent thousands of masks to hospitals there.  And on and on. . . . .       Enough already.  This is a wonderful venue with wonderful folks.  When you're in the area, check it out!

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: We have been intending to drive out to this brewery since we tasted one of their beers at a local tap house. so we made the drive and we're not disappointed in the selection of beers and at the location of the brewery which is outside of marble falls on its own property. The patio area was very large the service was great and the selection of beers was wonderful. we love visiting this place and was extra happy about the fact that it is a non-profit and gives back to the community. if you're wanting to have a nice little day trip out to marble falls to visit this place pick a nice sunny day bring the kids along cuz there's things for them to do out there too and let the adults have some good adult beverages.

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: We loved the vibe here! Tips are donated to charity and believe me, they've supported lots of agencies with over $230,000 in donations. We arrived within an hour of closing and were treated wonderfully. The bartender helped us select a flight and upon closing our tab, she treated me to a taste of Coconut Lux which wasn't part of my flight. Save the World is a completely inclusive space and is considerate of pandemic related issues. The inside space is reserved for vaccinated guests and was an enjoyable place to enjoy our selections.

reviews.author: Todd H.
reviews.description: Had to stop at the brewery as the name was great and we needed a cold pop.  Discovering that profits go to charity was inspiring.  Liked the place out on their own land and sat on the porch enjoyed a beer and some good conversation with a local.  We were visiting from Wisconsin and it was interesting learning about the brewery and the local sites while we were at STW.  Since I am more of an IPA guy and my wife a stout person their beer wasn't our overall cup of tea.  However, as mentioned above we did enjoy our time there and had to get a couple of shirts, hats etc. to support them and the cause. Definitely a recommended place to stop if you are in the southern hill county outside of Austin.

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: Fun place with good beer and a great mission. Proceeds over cost are donated to charity. If it seems pricy you are just giving to a good cause.

reviews.author: Courtney R.
reviews.description: Finally able to stop in after following on fb for awhile.  Wonderful brewery location, staff and customers!   I enjoyed my flight and my husband had the seasonal pumpkin and peach saison.  Truly enjoyed each one and look forward to returning

reviews.author: Nicholas B.
reviews.description: Such a fun brewery and set up for community gathering. There are food trucks and all kinds of activities and plenty to do. There's covered seating and seating that put you in the sun in a nice way. The copy selections are really tremendous. And we love that the brewery is a nonprofit supporting valuable causes.

reviews.author: Jackie C.
reviews.description: First timers my fiancé and I decided to check them out,l. The brick oven pizza was deliciously amazing. Customer service was great. Surprisingly the peppermint stout was pretty good. My favorite was the lager.

reviews.author: Ronda A.
reviews.description: What an amazing experience! The beers were fanominal and Liegh was amazing. She picked us a flight that fit us to a tee. The atmosphere was warm, inviting and extremely friend.

reviews.author: Jen H.
reviews.description: We were doing a beer tour from Fredericksburg on the way home to Georgetown and this is one of our stops and absolutely loved it! Everybody we met was so friendly, they give you fresh popcorn with your beer, the beer is delicious, you get to keep your glass and a percentage of their sales goes to charity! What else can you ask for!? One of the best breweries I've ever been to hands down! I'm so happy we found it and we plan on visiting often and bringing our pups with us next time. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Charly T.
reviews.description: Gwen and the ladies are great!  Great beer. The stout and the Belgian are great beers. Fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Ever since STW has been putting out beers, I can't say my boyfriend and I ever really buy any of their beers when we're out and about. None of their mainstays have ever really been standouts and in this cramped market, your beers have to be good and clean. That being said, we've been wanting to check out their taproom/brewery and it finally came to be when we spent a night out in Marble Falls.  Since the taproom is only open on the weekends, it was busy on a Saturday afternoon. It appears a lot of locals come here, which is GREAT! Families, couples, it's a great space for everyone. The taproom itself is air conditioned but if you want more seating, the warehouse space in the back is setup with extra picnic tables--just no a/c back there. There was a food truck out front in case you get hungry.  We went with a tasting paddle with a couple of their mainstays and the rest were their seasonals. The pricing is just right (about $1-$2/tasting).   Almost everything we tasted was phenolic (band-aid tasting-ish). The only thing that we could really drink was the wit, peach saison and our favorite was the Flanders red. The Flanders red was a great sour that fit to style and no off-flavors!   I want this place to do well because the owners are SO NICE (I mean, she's Vietnamese, so I obviously support my peeps) and I love what they're about -- but they need to fix their brewing process to get cleaner beer. All of our homebrew friends that have been here have had the same experience with the beers, so we're not alone.   If they can fix that, I might consider buying their beers when I'm at a bar, but otherwise, I just can't.

reviews.author: Rich G.
reviews.description: When in Marble Falls check this place out. Our daughter is a member of their mug club.   The owners give back to the community- some of the profits help fund local projects.   Love having BBQ. (See attached photo). Small place - friendly owner Plus excellent BBQ.   Save The World is only open Friday and Saturday. But you can buy their beers at many local restaurants.

reviews.author: Paul M.
reviews.description: Very nice people and great beer!   20$ for a 6 pack 2 Koozies, an opener and a bag of pretzels!   Express lunch!   BOOM!

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: This place was so highly talked about by one of my husband's coworker that is had been added to our list. They could not say enough about it - they even talked about making it a road trip. Marble Falls is a little over an hour and a half from San Antonio. So Saturday came and it was a perfect day for hubby and I to go check it out- we had no plans, it was sunny and early.   We got there a little after 1pm and well...I didn't get it. I mean the hype that was so over the top - I just expected something out of this world.   Yes there are a few picnic tables out front on a hill and the obligatory kids jungle gym (at a bar nowadays) -there was no one there but I thought- wow, if there really would be kids (little ones), I could see them tumbling down the hill and not in a fun way.   Once inside I realized this is not what we had in mind. It's lovely for sure. Old wine barrels as a few tables, a sectional and another sofa and a larger table right next to the bar. Because of all of this furniture, it makes it hard to get to the bar to order.   The staff was nice and knowledgeable - we ordered one of the flights and that included a stout, quad, dubbel, cherry, barley wine, and something else - fine beer but not fantastic. Staff let us know there was free pop corn out in the brewery side. - apparently they sometimes have a food truck but not today. They had more tables with some games with the door opened to the outside which made for a nice breeze. We did get some popcorn but it was so salty that I felt I was just eating salt.   We looked around for other places in the surrounding area and there was nothing appealing via my yelp app. We thought about going to Austin but is is over an hour drive.  I had envisioned Jester King-like place but it was far from this.   We left after our one flight - another 1 1/2 hour drive back home. I think that is part of the challenge- you know if you are somewhere off I-35 you can always drive 15 min and find somewhere else to try. Here? You are pretty limited.

reviews.author: Christie A.
reviews.description: How can you not like an establishment that gives back?   From the moment you drive up, you can just tell it's going to be a wonderful day. The brewery sits atop of a hill in a serene scenic area, and as you enter you're warmly welcomed by locals, tourists, and experienced brewman to help you pick the most delightful beer.   I definitely recommend the Wit if you're looking for something light and crisp. The brewery then opens up to a second floor seating area filled with picnic benches, tall standing machines, and yummy popcorn machine popping away.   We spent the afternoon playing jenga, and took in the outside to have a few games of corn hole. If you're in Marble Falls, this is a definite must.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: We dropped in for a flight and stayed for hours. The owners know and love good beer and it shows.  They were welcoming and informative hosts.   We were headed to Dallas with our dogs and were able to bring them in the brewing area so we were able to stay longer than we initially expected.   If we lived closer we would be regulars.  I don't know when I enjoyed a brewery more. The place was full when we left as well and they attract a happy, friendly crowd.  Also free popcorn so there is that.  Smart. Makes me want to wash it down with more beer.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We met some friends here and were glad we did. This place seems to have a beer for everyone, which all breweries should in my opinion. The first beer is $6.50, but comes with the glass, so your next beer is just $3:50 for the refill. It also has an air conditioned section so you can enjoy your beer in these hot Texas summers. It amazes me at how many of these breweries aren't air conditioned. This is a very cool brewery that we will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kristina C.
reviews.description: Went in on a Saturday around 1:30pm. A few other groups, but a nice calm vibe. The staff was really friendly, and very helpful. Lots of choices for different palates. Enjoyed it!

reviews.author: Kay R.
reviews.description: We stumbled across Bear King Brewing Co. as we were driving back to our lodgings. Here was a chance to stop for a cold one and a little taste of Texas with their Pimento Cheese appetizer. Both were great.  I had a Wandering Blonde Ale, which was excellent. Light and refreshing, but with real flavor -- something often missing in a blonde ale. The Hubs had a Hazy Ale, which was crisp and had an almost grapefruity tang on the tongue.  Being out-of-townersof the California persuation, we spotted pimento cheese on the menu and decided to give this southern staple a try. It was fantastic -- cheesy, garlicky, oniony, with a very slight spiciness to it. It's served with excellent ciabatta bread slices that have been grilled with olive oil, I think. The bread was great on its own, and the pimento cheese raised it to a whole new level of tastiness. I'd have happily ordered a second round of just the appetizer if dinner wasn't awaiting us elsewhere.   They have a good happy hour M-Th from 4-6 where the beers were $2 off. The pimento cheese app was $5.50, the happy hour beers were $4 each (16 oz), so we got out of there for just $13.  Great seating areas inside and out, too. Big fans in the large covered (non-smoking) patio made it a nice place to sit on an early evening. Pups are allowed on the patio if they're leashed at all times.  All in all, this place really does it right -- good beer, good food, and great ambience. Can't ask for more than that.

reviews.author: Gus L.
reviews.description: Bear King has a great local brewpub here! Glad I stopped in on my recent visit to the area. The selection of beers and food is not extensive, but has a good variety and is well executed. The beers run from a nice blonde to a few tasty stouts and even a barley wine... as well as the ever popular hopy beers. The food follows suits with a decent selection of burgers, tacos and some great appetizers. The poutine and the fajita tacos were a great standout and I would head ab ck just for those. The only constructive criticism I would offer is on tasters, they have a great flight available but apparently their system doesn't allow you to get (and pay for) a single taster, you can get a free splash or a half pour...but I wanted just a taster of the barley wine :). Maybe next time. To tie it all off, the staff here was super friendly and helpful and did a great job of keeping the tables cleared, the drinks filled and the food flowing. Keep it up y'all!  Cheers!

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: This place was a pleasant surprise of a stop on our way back home to Austin from Inks Lake. We'd been to Blue Bonnet cafe before, and Bear King Brewing is right around the corner.  The space is open and clean, though a bit nondescript, and it seems like they could make it a bit more "fun" other than just a bunch of TV screens. We started with a flight a beers, most of whose names we've forgotten, but all of them were good. We particularly liked the hazy IPA and got another pint of that to share.  The food was better than expected. We got the Texas poutine as an app, and while we'd hardly call it poutine in any capacity, it was pretty good with the pulled meat and pico on top. For dinner, we split the turkey bigger and added the delight salad on the side, which was a decent portion. We enjoyed the burger, but there was a bit too much of whatever the spread was on it (pimento?) that was kind of overwhelming. The salad was basic, but got the "greens" job done.  What this place really has going for it is value: decent food at a decent price. It's a pleasant atmosphere with friendly and competent service. We'd be happy to go again if we were nearby, but it's not really a "destination" spot.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: After checking out Sweet Berry we took to Yelp to find a place to lunch. Our first choice was closed and we felt like we'd be ok to give this place a try. Upon arrival around 230 PM there were tons of empty tables. We figured we had missed the lunch rush but apparently we were wrong. We immediately placed our order and having frequented many breweries across the state and country we knew there would be a bit of a wait. After about 20 minutes we got 1 appetizer and 1 meal (burger) for someone in our party. The food runner assured us the remaining appetizer and 3/4 of our meals (also burgers) would be out shortly. Time went by and at 20 minutes since the first food came out we stopped a food runner to check to see how much longer the remainder of our food would be. She said,"Our kitchen is backed up and it'll be out soon." 10 more minutes goes by and we stopped another food runner to see if they could check for us. Again nothing. Finally a 3rd food runner see's that we've been sitting there awhile (mind you were watching people who ordered after us get their food) and comes to ask if we're still waiting on food. We said yes and while we weren't upset there was a wait we were upset 1/4 of our party got their food 40 minutes ago. She went and checked and 5 minutes later the remainder of our food came out. One item was requested without onion yet their were onions right on top. The food runner had offered to take it back and fix it but after waiting 1.5 hrs and 40 minutes after the first person in our party received their food we told her not to worry about it we'd just pick them off. I'm not sure what was going on in the kitchen but I'm not sure how the cooks/chefs can make 1 burger and yet  it the other 3 at once.   As far as the food it was mediocre at best. We had 4 different burgers and they were ok. We also had the Tx poutine and Buffalo wings. I'd save your money on those. The gravy on the poutine was the best part but fries were soggy due to super wet brisket and pico on top. Wings again were ok. I believe they're smoked but the skin was not crispy at all. Can't comment on the beers as we didn't order any. Maybe that's their money maker and the food is an after thought.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: The in-laws have retired to Round Mountain and Bear King is now THE place to meet! Food is good. Beer is good. Service is good. Nice setting. Lots of games on TV. Dog friendly. And Dad picks up the tab...it's perfect!

reviews.author: Gail K.
reviews.description: The beer and service were great but the nachos were weird with pickled onions,  cold jalapeños,  and Parmigiano cheese...

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: If you get hungry on the way to Fredericksburg from the Austin area, tbis is a great place to stop.  Excellent beer and great food.

reviews.author: Christine C.
reviews.description: Good food and great beer.  Ordered swiggy ipa nice crisp taste to enjoy with a smashing burger!

reviews.author: Jacob T.
reviews.description: There's a decent variety of a beer here, about 8 to 12 types on tap at any given point. There's only been one that I haven't liked, and that was the Milky Way chocolate beer. The thing that really sets Bear King apart though is the quality of the food. You usually don't expect a lot from a bar, but I have enjoyed their queso and their tacos. I personally did not enjoy the poutine, but several of my friends did.  Not a bad place to go for dinner and a drink.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Stopped in again today... GREAT food as always- had the turkey burger and chips and queso, beer is great- had a hazy IPA. This place is a consistently great brewery that is light and bright. It seemed like the employees were a little more cheerful today than last visit despite it being busy. We will continue to come to this great brewery that Marble Falls is lucky to have!!

reviews.author: Bonnie R.
reviews.description: Had dinner here on our way to Burnet.  The beer was good and we liked be patio area.  My husband liked his burger and fries, however my southwest style El Oso salad was marginal.  It was mostly lettuce and some chicken but not much else as the menu described it.  The dressing wasn't a dressing but more like a dipping sauce.  It didn't pour out of the container at all.  Our friends had the child's chicken tenders and the shrimp tacos.  The chicken tenders looked good.

reviews.author: Cora W.
reviews.description: I had the Greenhouse burger (no bun) and truffle fries. The truffle fries are amazing - crisp with just the right amount of truffle and parmesean - plus a beautiful presentation.  My husband had the Texas poutine. The gravy on that is phenomenal. He, also, had a chocolate marshmallow stout while I had Austin Eastciders. He loved the stout.

reviews.author: Tammy V.
reviews.description: Enjoyed their patio, burgers, and beer selection on a warm and breezy fall afternoon!

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We had been playing golf and stopped at the Bluebonnet Cafe for a late lunch and saw this place from it's parking lot. Looked cool, so we checked it out. Great vibe and great beer. Wished we had skipped the late lunch at the Bluebonnet and had eaten here. Everyone around us had great looking meals. The reason for the 4 stars and not 5, was that we did not have any food. Maybe next time. BTW, the Hefeweizen was great.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Delicious burger friendly staff great beer what more can you ask for !!  Try the brisket burger u will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Sarah N.
reviews.description: We are visiting the area. What an amazing place. Service was excellent, beer was awesome. You have to get the nachos. We loved it so much

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great brewpub in the middle of downtown Marble Falls. They have a great patio and indoor space. We've been here a couple of times now and and they consistently have good beers. My boyf really likes their black IPA.   Their COVID-19 protocols are a little annoying though - it just takes so much time to order through the site. Not sure why places do this, I think it's fine if you want to take the order at the front and not have waiter service, but ordering through a site on your phone is my least favorite thing a biz can do while I'm at the restaurant.   Anywho - the food is good. Well seasoned burger and good tacos.   If you're in the area, give them a visit if you're looking for good beer!

reviews.author: Joan M.
reviews.description: The Parmesan at killer! Do not share  I love their darker beers. Also pet friendly!  Well. We always make sure to take our friends and family there when the visit.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: We are visiting on vacation and I'll just say I was not impressed with the quality of food. They have multiple positive reviews, but def didn't hit the spot for us.

reviews.author: Stephanie G.
reviews.description: SOLID 5 STARS.   The food was fresh, hot, and lots of flavor. We had the nachos with brisket, could definitely feed two people, delicious! And the Legendary burger, only critique would be the pickle was not as crunchy as I prefer, but still a juicy flavorful burger, fries were great too!   We had a the hefe and the pecan porter, they were both fantastic!   They followed all COVID-19 restrictions to a T! And we felt very safe and comfortable dining in (it was my husband's first time dining in at a restaurant since March, so that's saying something).   Will pray to the beer and food Gods to please send us a Bear King Brewery to Jonestown, TX!   Also- special thank you to Kevin for helping us out in a pickle about printing a form. A+ SERVICE!

reviews.author: M. H.
reviews.description: great service though they were severely short staffed.  food was ok- great chicken tenders but chips were a bit greasy.

reviews.author: Desirae O.
reviews.description: Nice little place after a long day of riding. Staff is always welcoming and attentive. We are a fan of the pizza. It's so good we don't want to explore anything else on the menu. Beer is pretty decent. Definitely a go to place when we are in town.

reviews.author: Carly V.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery in Marble Falls. Great beer. Friendly staff. Trivia nights are the best.

reviews.author: Stacia H.
reviews.description: This place is sub par at best.  Queso came with cheese skin on top...Gross!  Wings were awful, I think they must have been reheated about 3 times. I asked for them super crispy but that's not what I got. I got old wings! I ordered a dozen ate 3 of the most decent looking ones, still paid for it all. Didn't want to even bother with getting into it with the server.   Save yourself the trip and money. Make the wings and queso at home and buy a better beer!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: To be honest it's not usually very easy to get five stars out of me unless you're doing something really right.  It seemed to us that the best time to be at Marble Falls is during the off-season where the rates are great and the restraunts are not crowded. This restaurant came well recommended to us from some locals that we talked to.  As someone who works in the beer and wine business, I'm always looking for a great brewpub to explore. This place definitely did not disappoint as all the beers styles were right on point when I got a sample flight. My wife had a salad and I opted for the fish and chips. I think I found the best item on the menu because it was a huge piece of perfectly cooked haddock. I will actually say it was one of the best fish and chip baskets I've had in my life. My wife loved her salad and all in all it was a great meal at what I'd call a very great price. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Fedor E.
reviews.description: Cool atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff.  Beer was fine. Not bad, not impressive. Had the pale ale and the blond. I tasted some of the stouts my wife ordered .  The food was notably below average for a brew pub. I had some pulled pork nachos that I couldn't really eat. Weird combo of ingredients but even the pork itself was seasoned strangely , similar to chorizo .   Pizza was pizza. Tasted alright but was misshapen, and their sausage serving was so sparse I wasn't even sure it was on the pizza at first.   Mac and cheese we ordered for the kids had spicy seasoning on it, and they still didn't like it even after we removed it. I've never seen them not eat Mac and cheese before .  So I'm summation, cool place to meet with friends for beer, but not ideal place to have dinner. (My family goes to a lot of breweries and good food is pretty much the norm ).   Beer was cheap but food was overpriced . My tab was $70 after tip , which is not the usual ballpark for what we spend at a restaurant or brewery .

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We stopped in here after a morning of golf. Thought we would have a beer and some food. There really weren't any beers to our liking, all they had were IPA's, pale ales and a watermelon beer. Not our style, but many seem to like this trend. I wanted something light and refreshing like a pilsner or a Hefeweizen.  Our food was okay, the fried pickles were excellent, my fish and chips were good and my wife said her BLT was okay.

reviews.author: Victor R.
reviews.description: The staff are always friendly and welcoming, the brew, food and atmosphere are awesome!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch while driving through, been since pre-pandemic since we were here. Quick, friendly service, and they seem to have stepped up their beer as well. More choices than I remembered, and the the two IPAs I tried were very good. The burgers and sides were well done and tasty, and more than ample.

reviews.author: Jacob T.
reviews.description: This place is now under new ownership / management and the quality of food has increased tremendously.  The staff is very friendly, and the prices are reasonable.  The burgers are especially tasty, and they now offer the Beyond Burger for any vegetarians in your group.  The beer is excellent - I especially enjoy the IPAs they have on tap.  During the pandemic they are also doing curbside orders, which is very convenient.

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: we stopped in late afternoon for some brews and some food. We weren't disappointed in our selection of bruise and had several favorites. The food menu was quite extensive and we settled on the spicy sausage pizza with mushrooms. Lots of food and you won't be disappointed. My favorite beer was one of the IPAs I believe it was called lake water. Regardless, lots of good choices and they even had three guest beers which we took advantage of one. My only complaint was that social distancing was not enforced here enough such that we felt uncomfortable and left a little in it earlier than what we would normally have.

reviews.author: Charles A.
reviews.description: Same prices, smaller portions. Like, WAY smaller portions. It's no optical illusion -- their chicken tacos have about as much chicken as my thumb is massive. I had two others that were even smaller.   Had to order a second order of sweet potato fries because they reduced their portion size there as well to only a handful. I don't usually bitch and whine about this kind of stuff, but this is kind of ridiculous.  The staff is nice but no one was wearing a mask which is against the law at this point too.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: We stopped by for dinner and it was okay. The pizza was super salty and the beer battered fish was really heavy on the batter. The staff were friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was loud and really echo-y. Probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Rich G.
reviews.description: It is still a 5. Love Double Horn always great service and good food. Here for lunch on Saturday.   Started with fried dill pickle appetizer. I had the individual pizza with sausage and pepperoni excellent. Others had a taco.   Understand the original owners are back. Making some updates - reworked the kitchen.   Excellent beers - service and food.

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: This establishment was one we hadn't been to before and we thought, let's see what they got.  We entered the restaurant and we greeted by cheerful servers and seated (socially distant of course). We did not know what kind of beer to get and our server recommended the "beer flight" which is few oz of 4 beers.  We tried the blond to the dark to see which ones we might want to order in a larger glass.  We also tried their super pretzel and pepperoni pizza.  All of the food was very good as was the beer.  We choose to go with a Blond Growler to bring home.  Definitely a good experience.  Easy in and out in Marble Falls off the 281.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: This brewery has some tasty beers (we tried their Blond and IPA) and the food was "ok". I had the Bison burger which was very tasty and my husband had the schnitzel (which he said was too dry).  A table near us ordered a large pizza and it was delivered with the pieces cut into SQUARES.  Noooooooo  The atmosphere of the main dining room is a bit echoey and lacking any real character.  The bar area is fairly small with a few tables and bar with barstools.   Waitress was friendly and service was good.  Women's bathroom clean but I was told that the men's bathroom was not.

reviews.author: Kevin J.
reviews.description: In town visiting so we could see the Christmas lights at Lake Park.  We're starving so decided on some place local and close before walking thru Christmas wonderland.  Four of us were seated quickly, unfortunately that was the only thing quick all evening.  Three of us ordered beers.  Seems like they needed to go over the river and thru the wood to bring back the beers.  It was quite the wait.  At least they were cold.  Ordered our food.  Three of us had burgers and the fourth had the fries appetizer, covered in cheese.  Family of three sat down at the table next to us about 20 minutes after we had arrived.  They ordered, ate, and were leaving at the time we got our food.  Over an hour wait, for something that is fairly simple to make.  Waiter came by once to get another beer order.  Finished both beers slowly, and still had not received our food.  Finally delivered our burgers,  ready to dig in.  Presentation was nice, looked good.  But took a bite and realized looks can be deceiving.  Patty was drier than the Sahara desert.  All of the flavor and juice had been cooked out.  Maybe this is why it took so long to get our food, they were too busy overcooking it.  The fried okra was not any better.  Almost had a doughy texture to it.  Not crisp and definitely no flavor.  Also two of the beers on the menu were out.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: It was my first time being here with my family since moving to this town and we came in on trivia night which was cool I suppose (not my thing) so the other people in my party played while I did my own thing.. ya know whatever. Well for one the musics was incredibly loud the people at my table couldn't hear each other in order to discuss their answers so they are having to yell.. what's the point in the trivia if everyone is screaming their answers? So I spelled out a word in my Facebook search bar and was aggressivly told by Trenton who also was having to talk loudly "to get off my phone"  1. I wasn't playing which I told him 3 times and he kept saying how he would disqualify us.. first of all who is "we" because I was not involved in trivia which if you would've listened I told you 3 times , and  Who is he to tell a grown adult to get off their phone... sir until you pay my bill please mind your business... basically the level of aggression over me showing my mother how to spell a word on my phone was ridiculous I don't care if you care about the spelling but clearly she did... I understood when you said no phones in the beginning (there we LOTS of people using theirs because my whole table was taking about it) but I was not playing and I didn't enjoy hearing people get irritated and screaming their answers and ideas at one another either.... Trivia nights not THAT serious dude... take a chill pill and maybe lay off the beer while working so you don't seem so hateful. Other than that everything else was okay but due to the experience and how uncomfortable I felt after having that interaction I probably won't be back and won't recommend.

reviews.author: amber p.
reviews.description: The employee who seats incoming guests was wearing a very politically divisive shirt which contained vulgar language. No matter who you support, I would call that unprofessional, and that you only want to get half the public's business

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The brewery environment is covid-friendly, clean and the staff is welcoming and extremely kind! The beer selection is second to none (especially the holiday pumpkin ale) a wide selection of food! We enjoyed the Currywurst an Oktoberfest 2020. It's a must-visit brewery experiencing!!

name: River City Grille
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Stephanie P.
reviews.description: We are visiting from out of town and stopped by here for dinner on a Friday night with our 3 kids. The food was great, and came out fast and hot. The service was also great! Everyone had a smile and was happy to help with anything we needed. The view is amazing as well! Definitely 5 stars.

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: We were in town visiting a friend and she made lots of suggestions but we ended up here and I personally am thankful this is where we ended up at.   Let me start off by saying that the staff is some of the friendliest folks I've met. We had a waitress who helped out our waitress and she did it with a smile.   We ordered the chips, queso and salsa to start off with. At first glance the salsa looked like it was marinara sauce but it was actually good. The queso was a little thin but still good.   We ordered a steak salad and a cheeseburger and both meals were good. The cherry limeade was delicious and seriously I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place.   It's located on the water so you can sit outside and take in the views or sit inside and sit by the window and still have a beautiful view.   Give 'em a try!

reviews.author: Kris V.
reviews.description: Good food, beautiful view. The outdoor seating overlooks the river. The dining room is all windows so you can sit in the ac and still have a view.  I'd imagine before covid the dining room held a few more tables.  The Paul's chicken is a large breast breaded in chips, topped with lots of hatch Chile and shredded cheese. I liked it better after asking for a side of white gravy.  The green beans are honest, not cooked to death, still green. The baked potato was typical, though not seasoned on the outside like I'm used to.  All in all, it's plenty.  The chicken fried steak was two pieces, actually seasoned in the breading, tender enough, and disappeared quickly. Gravy is good too.  The scratch cheesecake was good. I got plain, without toppings, which they offer a few. It's baked, not too dense, thick enough crust.  The bread pudding was a cereal bowl full of yummy. Pecans and raisins all smothered in a bourbon sauce, not an icing. Very good.  Prices are a smidge high, but expected for the area.  Staff was pleasant, quick to respond.  I'll come back next time we are in the area.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Family trip to Marble Falls, TX. We have been to River City Grille multiple times and for good reason. Good food and great service. The wait is always a bit long but it's because people want to eat here. The outside river view is a plus! We will be back.

reviews.author: Marlo C.
reviews.description: Enjoyed a delicious meal on the deck(overlooking Lake Marble Falls). The fish taco's were absolutely scrumptious! Salads were fresh and yummy. Service was top notch(Shane was our server). We shared a generous portion of bread pudding for dessert.  Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: Nice lake view restaurant in marble fall, the price is very good for the portion of food. Most of the food is about $10 unless you go for steak. There's outdoor seating as well as indoor seating with large window with beautiful lake view.  The service is very fast and attentive. I ordered calamari which are top with cheese powder which seems strange, it's also like a calamari fingers instead of rings. With cheese is not my favorite part. The fish taco came in three large pieces of taco with the two pieces of filet in each taco, huge portion. The green chili burger is juicy and has a good kick to it but the buns are soggy which needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Ried S.
reviews.description: I want to start by saying that the service here is probably the beat I've experienced since the pandemic began. In a world where so many restaurants are understaffed and waiters overwhelmed, the team here could not have been more attentive from the moment we sat down. There was no waiting for anything - they were incredibly intuitive and knew just when to check in with us and offer refills or bring extra napkins. 5 stars for the service.   The food was pretty good which is why I'm giving 4 stars. I had a delicious green chili burger, but the calamari fell flat for me. I don't know why they sprinkled parmesan cheese on it. My recommendation would be to offer this on the side.   Overall, solid option in Marble Falls with beautiful views over the lake. Sit outside when the weather is tolerable.

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: We stopped in here while on vacation to eat by the water and were not disappointed.   The food was great. I got the famous pork chop and green beans and it was delicious.   The atmosphere is great. We sat inside and still had great lakeside views. The parking was easy and even at prime time, we easily got a table.   The staff was friendly but the service was disorganized and slow. That is the only reason we aren't giving it 5 stars.

reviews.author: Gracie G.
reviews.description: If I could give it 0 stars, I would. Called 2 min before getting there to make sure the wait time was acceptable for a group of nine and the manager lied and said we took 10 minutes to get there and the tables that they could have used for us, were given to other parties and that they couldn't hold the tables for us. Trashy place, smelled disgusting, save your money and go elsewhere with better service!

reviews.author: Michael O.
reviews.description: I eat here anytime I'm in town for work. Beautiful views of the Colorado river on the deck. Me or my guest have had almost everything on the menu and everything thing is worth trying. If you are looking for a local place, give this place a try. The pork chops are amazing.

reviews.author: Rob H.
reviews.description: The wife decided to stop in today after I had grabbed some mounts from the taxidermist in town. We got there just as they opened and glad we did. We got a table on the balcony. Weather was perfect, staff was friendly, food was good and view is awesome. I had the fish tacos which I loved and she had the pulled pork tacos that she liked a lot. Portions were perfect as was flavor. My only gripe would be paying for salsa and chips. This is Texas! It should almost be a given to have chips and salsa at the table! We will most definitely be making a return trip.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: We were heading back to our hotel late and wanted something quick to eat. We decided to share the Fried Shrimp House Favorite with sweet potato fries and cole slaw. The shrimp were OK but cooked just a little too long for our liking. The sweet potato fries were just barely cooked and were just limp and tasteless. The cole slaw was actually pretty good. I doubt we'll return, which is a shame given the nice view they have.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: I have always enjoyed having lunch here. The food is good, and the management and staff are incredibly service minded. The pork-chops, are bone in with a unique brown sugar and cumin glaze, cooked to perfection. Also as an appetizer try the loaded fried potatoes .

reviews.author: Joan M.
reviews.description: Not one of my faves, service and food have always been mediocre. Great if you want to dine with a view of the river.

reviews.author: Heather W.
reviews.description: Awesome to be able to order and pay online so we were able to grab lunch without a long stop on our road trip.  Really nice customer service and clean bathrooms.  Food was disappointing. I would skip this restaurant next time unless in a hurry.

reviews.author: Blaine B.
reviews.description: I have been to this restaurant 4 or 5 times over the last 3 years. The food has always been mediocre but edible until my visit the other day that was with my wife. My sweet tea tasted like catfish and so did the green beans. I was very disappointed. My wife had a steak sandwich which she couldn't eat either. If your a fan of catfish then this is the place for you. I am not and don't want want my sweet tea to taste like it was brewed in the lake nor the food that I ordered. We both did not feel well after our meal, maybe it was just in our minds because the meal was such a disappointment or maybe it was because everything was cooked in the same grease as the catfish?

reviews.author: Drew D.
reviews.description: This was one of the first places I ate upon moving to Texas.   Usually imma chicken fried steak kinda dude (which theirs is actually incredible) but recently I've been on a sandwich kick.  The fried catfish sandwich actually bangs. The flavor was on point and the bread was super soft.  If I was just a tad bit fatter I could finish this monster and the fries, but unfortunately even my sweat shorts waistband had enough.  L

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to grab a bite when driving through. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the view of the river. The food was good but what stood out was the green chili and cheese potatoes, they were fantastic! The waitress was very nice , the food good and the view great. With a little more effort they could make this place epic. Either way, I recommend stopping here when your passing through , you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Garry H.
reviews.description: Considering the location of this restaurant, I was expecting some stupid crazy high prices. More on that later. I told the hostess this was our first time here and wanted to celebrate our anniversary on the patio. She immediately took us to the worst table on the patio. Thanks. The waitress had no problem putting us at one of the best tables on the patio. Your awesome! All staff were wearing masks. We ordered the Texas grilled Reuben and the Buffalo Chicken sandwich. Both were wonderful. Very seldom does Glenda finish a sandwich! Fries were good and the coleslaw was wonderful. I'm a huge fan of  Long John Silver's coleslaw, sweet and creamy. Very few places make it like that. River City Grille's was a perfect copy! Glenda stopped me from licking the bowl. Now, if your eating wonderful food on a wonderful patio at a wonderful restaurant facing a wonderful lake, your going to pay through the nose. Nope. Normal prices. That's why 5 stars. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Paul M.
reviews.description: Food was good.  Service originally was excellent.  However, I ate in the bar and the bartender took my credit card and ran off before I could tell him I wanted dessert.  I thought most restaurants automatically ask if you want that.  He had to run it again and kinda acted like it was my fault.   lol

name: Brass Hall
accommodations: DJ, Background Music, Juke Box, Live Music, Karaoke
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Joseph V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome!  The staff is great, always a fun mix of event types, good pricing on drinks, and we always have a blast here. I highly recommend trying this place out.  We've seen Randy Rogers, AJ Castillo, Z-Ro, Paul Wall, and I heard Jon B was coming in Feb 2022!!!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Worst night in a very long time, thanks to Brass Hall!  We had been unimpressed on a prior visit but decided to give them another shot when we heard that a band we like was playing there (Back in Black - a tribute to ACDC).  We bought tickets weeks ago and paid extra for "reserved seating".  Brass Halls FB and ticket page said show at 7.  Because we were making the long drive from Austin, we FB messaged to confirm time.  We were told "maybe 8".  We showed up at 7:30 and our paid for and reserved seats were two barstools behind a giant mirrored pillar, with NO view to the stage.  We were told that was all that was available.  Brass Hall is a total dingy dive bar with pool tables, noisy game room, watered down drinks and a stage in the corner.  Because we had already had a few beers with dinner at a brewery, we decided to pace ourselves with drinking and wait until the band came on.  8:00 went by, then 8:30.  People around us, who'd been waiting for a band to come on at 7, were on rounds 4 and 5 of drinks and becoming louder and more obnoxious. 9:00 goes by and Back in Black is finally starting to enter the building one at a time to set up their equipment.  It's 9:20, Back in Black are still not in their stage clothes, no sound check has been done and they seem in no hurry.  9:30, we've had enough and leave.  We wasted a long drive and $50 of tickets all because a venue that BOOKED a band could not even accurately say when they would play.  Very poor management and booking.  And shame on Back in Black for not caring about what time was posted or about fans like us who drove a long distance to see them.  One final "cherry" on the steaming lump of goo that is Brass Hall....    The bathrooms.  There are no stall doors in either the men's or women's bathrooms.  What you have instead are... (wait for it), TA-DA -- velvet curtains!  Not only are they totally lacking in privacy but what an absolute hygenic wasteland.  Blue light anyone?

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: Hoped to have a Saturday night drink tonight.  $20.00 cover (per person) for a tribute band.   That's a little steep, even for a tribute band.   Don't know if that's a band decision or a bar decision, but the math will never work out.  Less patrons, less bar tab, less money.

reviews.author: Penii G.
reviews.description: Never disappointed when I come out. Though not frequent it's enough for me to know this place is genuine! They put every effort into making it a pleasant atmosphere no matter the occasion or show!! And now more of an excuse to come out. Every 1st Saturday of the month by friend DJ Smurf will be there! Brass Hall is a place you will come back to if you go at least once!!!

reviews.author: Pete F.
reviews.description: This is not a 4 Star because of the quality of the establishment, but, for the atmosphere of the venue and the people we stopped in to have a drink and to check it out. We were relative strangers to the place, but, we were welcomed by the bar staff and everyone was very open and friendly. The drinks were not expensive. The wife and I had 2 drinks each and the tab was $12.  They have an arcade, good sized dance floor and pool tables.  There is a DJ stand supposedly for weekend entertainment.  They do have weekend entertainment.   The place gives you a warm Texas feeling. The people in this small town so far have been neat and friendly. Very nice place to visit.

reviews.author: Christine B.
reviews.description: Drinks are very weak.  Bartenders are more interested in talk to each other than helping customers.  The straw that broke the camels back was when I ordered my husband a double crown and my drink.  The bartender poured my husband's drink and went to get mine, the other bartender picked up a bunch of dirty glass which included my husband's drink.  When the other bartender saw it he wanted the drink back so he could serve it no way my friend! Not coming here again.

reviews.author: Jennifer O.
reviews.description: This place was a waste of money for cover charge. DJ sucked ass - he needs to adjust his speakers, they crack when the music plays... he plays music so old-  today's 20's patrons their parents were  having sex to that music ... not up to date with music that draws a crowd.  More people were on the balcony smoking than being inside dancing... get a better talent if you plan to draw in the crowd.   Out of date music - too old school - not worth a shit--- his mixing sucks!! Hire someone with more experienced- if I wanted to see one lady show her twat I would would have gone to a strip club.  80's country - Keith Whitley Don't close your eyes(1988)  is his closing song... what a waste of time...  there are better DJ's in Marble Falls... guess you get what you pay for.  Check out his video of the club and you will see the only person dancing who said she's a friend of the DJ's and needed to come support her friend. Dated Friday Night / Saturday Morning - 9/29/18-9/30/18. Sad thing when your family doesn't even want you to DJ for their family reunion because you suck that much - let's go Brass Hall step up your game if you want real people to spend money at your establishment. The floor was danced on 10# of the time that alone says something.

reviews.author: Jared M.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, good booze, great music, cheap drinks, solid pool table. What's not to like? The live music they are bringing to the Marble Falls scene is also very impressive. The bartender Joe is knowledgeable and friendly. If you are a local, you probably already know -- Brass Hall is where it's at.

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: Worse entertainment ever the night before the 4th of July.  Also service was horrible!   Sat at bar with 2 waiters having conversations with customers while we sat and waited and waited and waited.  Never acknowledged us until I had to get their attention to order a beer.   Not impressed at all!

reviews.author: Kaitlyn T.
reviews.description: Best bar in Marble Falls, they're really raising the standards out there. Drinks are strong and cheap, the staff is very friendly and attentive. Great live music. I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Carl J.
reviews.description: Great place to hang, great place to play. Sound man Ben was really great, staff was incredible.

reviews.author: Angela A.
reviews.description: Talent was amazing, equipment was good, sound left a lot to be desired. This was my second time here on a Monday night. Might be my last.

reviews.author: R H.
reviews.description: Beware this s!th0le. Seriously horrible service. Never thought I'd be in a real life version of Paddy's Pub.

reviews.author: Joshua C.
reviews.description: The bartenders were great, and the folks at the bar were super friendly. We were out from Austin, and the drive was beautiful. Can't wait to go back again!

reviews.author: C C.
reviews.description: Love the re-vamped Brass Hall! Great place to watch a show or meet up with friends for a hand-crafted drink. The prices are fair, the staff seemed really great, and knew their stuff about booze. Can't wait to be back for some live music and dancing on their beautiful dance floor. Glad I found this spot!
